metadata.title: Help & FAQ - Sprint Timing Troubleshooting
metadata.description: Get help with TrackSpeed. FAQ on sprint timing setup, multi-device sync, crossing detection, and subscription management.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: If you need help with TrackSpeed or have any questions, we're here to assist you.

howItWorks.question: How does TrackSpeed work?
howItWorks.answer: TrackSpeed uses your phone's camera to detect when an athlete crosses the timing gate. The app uses camera-based motion detection to identify when the athlete's torso crosses the timing gate, providing millisecond-accurate timing.

equipment.question: Do I need special equipment?
equipment.answer: No! TrackSpeed works with just your phone. For split timing or start/finish gates, you can use two phones that sync together wirelessly.

models.question: What phone models are supported?
models.answer: TrackSpeed requires iOS 17 or later. For best performance, we recommend models with 120fps camera support.

accuracy.question: How accurate is the timing?
accuracy.answer: TrackSpeed achieves ~4ms timing accuracy using sub-frame interpolation and rolling shutter correction. When using two devices, our clock synchronization ensures both gates are aligned for accurate split times.

competitions.question: Can I use TrackSpeed for official competitions?
competitions.answer: TrackSpeed is designed for training and unofficial timing. For official competitions, please use certified timing equipment as required by your sport's governing body.

connecting.question: How do I connect two phones together?
connecting.answer: Both devices need to have TrackSpeed installed. One device creates a session as the 'host,' and the other joins. The devices connect automatically via peer-to-peer networking - no internet connection required.

cancel.question: How do I cancel my subscription?
cancel.answer: Subscriptions are managed through your Apple ID. Go to Settings → [Your Name] → Subscriptions → TrackSpeed → Cancel Subscription.

solutions: Ensure good lighting - the camera needs to clearly see the athlete
Position the phone so the athlete passes perpendicular to the camera view
Make sure the athlete's torso is visible in the frame
Try using a higher FPS setting (60 or 120fps) in settings
Ensure both devices have WiFi and Bluetooth enabled
Both devices should be within 30 feet of each other
Try closing and reopening the app on both devices
Make sure both devices are running the latest version of TrackSpeed

thermal.issue: The app is running slow or getting hot
solutions: Remove any phone case to help with cooling
Avoid direct sunlight on the device
Close other apps running in the background

feedbackSection.title: Feature Requests & Feedback
feedbackSection.description: We love hearing from our users! Visit our <feedbackLink>feedback board</feedbackLink> to vote on ideas, suggest new features, or report bugs. You can also email us at <emailLink>feedback@mytrackspeed.com</emailLink>.
